## Welcome to **George G. Vega Yon's** Website

I am an Assistant Professor of Research at the [Division of Epidemiology at the University of Utah](https://medicine.utah.edu/internalmedicine/epidemiology/){target="_blank"}. I work on studying [Complex Systems](https://cssociety.org/about-us/what-are-cs){target="_blank"} using [Statistical Computing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Computational_statistics){target="_blank"}. I have over ten years of experience developing scientific software focusing on high-performance computing, data visualization, and social network analysis.

<!-- Bio Section

### About Me -->

My training is in Public Policy (M.A. [UAI](https://www.uai.cl/){target="_blank"}, 2011), Economics (M.Sc. [Caltech](https://caltech.edu){target="_blank"}, 2015), and Biostatistics (Ph.D. [USC](https://usc.edu){target="_blank"}, 2020).

I obtained my Ph.D. in Biostatistics under the supervision of [Prof. Paul Marjoram](https://scholar.google.com/citations?user=Zj5ky5gAAAAJ&hl=en){target="_blank"} and [Prof. Kayla de la Haye](https://kayladelahaye.net){target="_blank"}, with my dissertation titled "[Essays on Bioinformatics and Social Network Analysis: Statistical and Computational Methods for Complex Systems](thesis.pdf){target="_blank"}."

I'm available for coding, data science, network science, and data visualization consulting.
